datafield.subfield: Exploring the effectiveness of online education in K-12 environments /
Tina L. Heafner, Richard Hartshorne, and Teresa Petty, editors.
Hershey, Pennsylvania (701 E. Chocolate Avenue, Hershey, Pa., 17033, USA) :

Online learning in Illinois high schools: the voices of principals! / Anthony G. Picciano, Jeff Seaman, Scott L. Day -- Challenges, opportunities, and trends in quality K-12 online environments / Marius Boboc -- Meeting the demand for online education: a study of a state-run program designed to train virtual K-12 teachers / Jayme Nixon Linton, Wayne Journell -- Unbounded reading: why online learning for K-12 students should be a literacy issue / Dixie D. Massey -- Practical guidelines for creating online courses in K-12 education / Wayne Journell -- Synchronous text chat (EduTexting) as an online learning tool / Tina L. Heafner, Michelle Plaisance -- Learning theory and online learning in K-12 education: instructional models and implications / Alex Kumi-Yeboah -- Effective online learning begins with effective teacher preparation / Laura Corbin Frazier, Barbara Martin Palmer -- The ever-evolving educator: examining K-12 online teachers in the United States / Jean Larson, Leanna Archambault -- Online learning in K-college classrooms: students and teachers establish social, cognitive, and teaching presences in digital spaces / S. Michael Putman, Brian Kissel, Jean Vintinner, Amy J. Good -- Establishing a mentoring relationship between pre-service and mentor teachers through windows into teaching and learning / Teresa Petty, Tina L. Heafner, Abiola A. Farinde, Michelle Plaisance -- Providing elementary and middle school science teachers with content and pedagogical professional development in an online environment / Mary V. Mawn, Kathleen S. Davis -- Challenges and opportunities in the first year of a 1:1 iPad initiative in a high-poverty, highly diverse urban high school / Gayle Y. Thieman -- Teaching history in the digital age / Scott M. Waring -- 3D multi-user virtual environments in science education: potential and challenges / Yufeng Qian -- Online discussion boards in the constructivist classroom / Lauren Lunsford, Bonnie Smith Whitehouse, Jason F. Lovvorn -- Best pedagogical practices for acknowledging and accommodating diversity in online courses / Christina Nash -- The integration of culturally relevant pedagogy and project-based learning in a blended environment / Daniel Kelvin Bullock -- High school teachers' gender-oriented perceptions of technology integration / Tina L. Heafner, Eric Groce, Elizabeth Bellows, Heather Coffey, Mette Evelyn Bjerre.
Access restricted to authorized users and institutions.

"This book combines empirical evidence and best practices in current K-12 distance learning and virtual schools, emphasizing current research and opportunities for administrators, teachers, researchers, teacher educators, and policymakers interested in the development and implementation of blended and electronic learning in primary and secondary education"--Provided by publisher.
Description based on title screen (IGI Global, viewed 10/09/2014).
